text: Orthodoxy means right belief or purity of faith.The term "orthodoxeia"comes from the Greek ortho ('right', 'correct') and doxa ('thought', 'teaching', 'glorification'). Orthodoxy is established by an absolute authority. "Orthodoxy," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2012-10-2. The term "orthodoxy" or "orthodox" is typically used to label or identify a specific kind of theology and doctrine of religion. Orthodoxy or "correct" belief is not subjective. ==References== == Related pages == * Orthodox Judaism * Eastern Orthodoxy * Oriental Orthodoxy ==Other websites== * History of Orthodox Christianity * Orthodox Christian Information Center Category:Theology Category:Christian terminology
